report_title: Online Pet Food & Pet Supply Sales in the US
executive_summary: Figures have been adjusted for inflation and are presented in 2024 currency. Online pet food and pet supply sales platforms have been enjoying massive revenue growth, driven by rising pet ownership and the popularity of e-commerce. The industry experienced strong growth during the pandemic's peak as owners substantially boosted e-commerce activity. Also, pet ownership surged as consumers sought companionship while locked down, expanding the online pet food and supply platform market. While ownership rates have eased in the wake of the pandemic, the boost to online pet food and supply sales remains.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Pet Ownership Rates and Online Shopping Surged Amid the Pandemic
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: During the pandemic, many consumers opted to adopt a pet, given the sudden boost in downtime, time at home and time spent alone, resulting in a swift rise in pet food and supply sales. E-commerce activity boomed during the nonessential business closures and shelter-in-place orders, so pet owners which steadily grew in number increasingly turned to online shops for their pets' needs.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Growing Use of the Internet is Propelling Revenue Upwards
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The growing ubiquity of e-commerce in daily life has equipped online retailers with a successful distribution and marketing network to gain market share, as it's already accessible to the majority of consumers who have a smartphone. Because of the online-only nature of the industry, pet food and supply sales are highly affected by consumer access to the internet and comfort using e-commerce tools. While some older consumers are uncomfortable shopping online, most pet owners are becoming even more tech-savvy.

The past five years have seen the emergence of a new kind of online pet food provider. Some platforms have found success by reducing consumers' engagement with sales systems and setting up recurring deliveries and payments.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: SUSTAINED GROWTH IN PET OWNERSHIP WILL SUPPORT STEADY SALES
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: - Consumers are expected to get married later and later on average, leading to a rise in the nation's single-household population. This is a crucial demographic for online pet food and supplies sales platforms since many single consumers adopt pets to find companionship. - Advancing medical care has continued to upgrade the care available to the US's elderly population. Retired consumers also adopt pets at higher rates than working demographics, which will hike the number of cats and dogs in the US. - Cat ownership will surpass dog ownership as consumers look for lower-maintenance pets.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: COMPETITION WILL EXPAND, LEAVING LITTLE ROOM FOR PROFIT GROWTH
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Price transparency has become increasingly important because of online comparison tools, enabling consumers to find the best available price for products and compare several retailers.
Premium pet products, which command a higher price and often generate a higher profit margin, can often justify their higher price tags, helping to mitigate price competition.
Moving forward, some state legislators will pass statutes requiring out-of-state e-commerce companies to collect sales tax from in-state customers, negatively impacting profitability.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: A greater focus on customized offerings could result in a new market
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: According to the Association for Pet Obesity Prevention, more than half of cats are considered overweight or obese as of 2019. Personalized diets, including exceptional food catered to obese animals, will serve as a potential niche market for online pet food and supply platforms.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Positive economic conditions will encourage greater spending
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Despite lingering fears of a potential recession, consumers are expected to enjoy growing disposable income and confidence, enabling them to spend in grocery stores and on discretionary purchases.

industry_definition: This industry retails pet foods and supplies through the internet. Examples of products offered by online pet supply stores include collars, leashes, health and beauty aids, medication, toys, pet carriers, and furniture.
key_trends: Since pet products sold by online pet retailers are almost identical, competition is fierce.
Pet humanization has promoted the trend toward product premiumization.
Faster internet connectivity allows pet owners to purchase pet products online seamlessly.
Online pet stores found success in the pandemic.
E-commerce is gaining ground over in-person shopping.
Consumers are increasingly seeking the convenience provided by online sales platforms.

market_segmentation.segment_description: This segment includes individuals under the age of 34, which is the youngest market demographic for online pet food and supply sellers.
This segment includes individuals aged 55 and older and represents the second-largest source of revenue for online pet food and supply sellers.

products_and_services.product_description: Includes all types of pet foods and treats.
Includes a variety of accessories for pets.
Includes medications and preventative care items.

tier_1_suppliers: General Warehousing & Storage in the US
Couriers & Local Delivery Services in the US
Toy & Craft Supplies Wholesaling in the US
tier_1_buyers: Pet Grooming & Boarding in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Measures the number of domesticated pets and companion animals consumers own.

business_locations.location_description: Businesses in the West benefit from access to a large portion of the nation's population and international trade ports.
The Southeast region is also home to some of the largest shipping ports in the country.
The Mid-Atlantic is attractive for its population density and proximity to international suppliers.
The Great Lakes region is a key distribution hub for nationwide businesses.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Ensures that pet food and treats are made in sanitary conditions and free from harmful substances.

regulations_points.regulation_title: THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF BOARDS OF PHARMACY
regulations_points.regulation_description: Mandates strict compliance for online pharmacies dispensing prescription medicines.

barriers_points.barrier_description: There is no industry assistance, which is a steady barrier to entry.
High level of technology change poses an increasing barrier to entry.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Market concentration eased as consumer patterns shifted.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Influx of new sellers dilutes concentration
concentration_points.concentration_description: An influx of new online pet sellers has diluted market concentration.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: THE ONLINE NATURE OF OPERATIONS KEEPS WAGE COSTS LOW
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Unlike traditional retailers, online shops often require fewer employees.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: PURCHASE COSTS REMAIN HIGH, BUT SHAKE THE EARLY-PERIOD VOLATILITY
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchases are the highest cost for online pet food and supply sellers.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: E-commerce businesses operate with low labor requirements.
High technology change affects capital expenses.

volatility_points.volatility_title: The essential nature of pet food and treats helps reduce volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: Consumers are willing to spend on their pets even during times of low consumer sentiment.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Pet supplies are most hurt during economic downturn
volatility_points.volatility_description: Demand for discretionary products faltered during the pandemic.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Industry growth depends largely on technological advancements.

FAQs.question: What is the American Pet Association (APA)?
FAQs.answer: The American Pet Association (APA) fosters pet ownership while offering industry-related insights.

FAQs.question: What is the Internet Merchants Association (IMA)?
FAQs.answer: The Internet Merchants Association (IMA) supports the interests of online retailers.

FAQs.question: Do companies specialize in one corner of the market or retail a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: Some companies exclusively retail specialized products, others retail a diverse range.

FAQs.question: Are companies' sales heavily dependent on the health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: Industry goods are considered nondiscretionary by pet owners.
